verses.verse: Then Job <WH347> answered <WH6030> and said <WH559>,
Oh that <WH3863> my vexation <WH3708> were but <WH8254> weighed <WH8254>, And all my calamity <WH1942> laid <WH5375> in <WH3162> the balances <WH3976>!
For now it would be heavier <WH3513> than the sand <WH2344> of the seas <WH3220>: Therefore have my words <WH1697> been rash <WH3886>.

For the arrows <WH2671> of the Almighty <WH7706> are within <WH5978> me <WH2534>, The poison whereof my spirit <WH7307> drinketh up <WH8354>: The terrors <WH1161> of God <WH433> do set themselves in array against me <WH6186>.
Doth the wild ass <WH6501> bray <WH5101> when he hath grass <WH1877>? Or loweth <WH1600> the ox <WH7794> over his fodder <WH1098>?
Can that which hath no savor <WH8602> be eaten <WH398> without salt <WH4417>? Or is there <WH3426> any taste <WH2940> in the white <WH7388> of an egg <WH2495>?
My soul <WH5315> refuseth <WH3985> to touch <WH5060> them <WH1741>; They are as loathsome food to me <WH3899>.
Oh that I might have <WH935> my request <WH7596>; And that God <WH433> would grant <WH5414> me the thing that I long for <WH8615>!
Even that it would please <WH2974> God <WH433> to crush <WH1792> me <WH5425>; That he would let loose his hand <WH3027>, and cut me off <WH1214>!
And be it still my consolation <WH5165>, Yea <WH5539>, let me exult in pain <WH2427> that spareth <WH2550> not <WH3582>, That I have not denied the words <WH561> of the Holy One <WH6918>.
What is my strength <WH3581>, that I should wait <WH3176>? And what is mine end <WH7093>, that I should be <WH5315> patient <WH748>?
Is my strength <WH3581> the strength <WH3581> of stones <WH68>? Or is my flesh <WH1320> of brass <WH5153>?
Is it not that I have no help <WH5833> in me <WH8454>, And that wisdom is driven quite from me <WH5080>?
To him that is ready <WH4523> to faint kindness <WH2617> should be showed from his friend <WH7453>; Even to him that forsaketh <WH5800> the fear <WH3374> of the Almighty <WH7706>.
My brethren <WH251> have dealt deceitfully <WH898> as a brook <WH5158>, As the channel <WH650> of brooks <WH5158> that pass away <WH5674>;
Which are black <WH6937> by reason of the ice <WH7140>, And wherein the snow <WH7950> hideth itself <WH5956>:
What time <WH6256> they wax warm <WH2215>, they vanish <WH6789>; When it is hot <WH2527>, they are consumed out <WH1846> of their place <WH4725>.
The caravans <WH734> that travel by the way <WH1870> of them turn aside <WH3943>; They go <WH5927> up into the waste <WH8414>, and perish <WH6>.
The caravans <WH734> of Tema <WH8485> looked <WH5027>, The companies <WH1979> of Sheba <WH7614> waited for them <WH6960>.
They were put to shame <WH954> because they had hoped <WH982>; They came <WH935> thither <WH2659>, and were confounded.
For now ye are nothing <WH7200>; Ye see a terror <WH2866>, and are afraid <WH3372>.
Did I say <WH559>, Give <WH3051> unto me <WH3051>? Or, Offer a present for me of your substance <WH3581>?
Or <WH4422>, Deliver me from the adversary <WH6862>'s hand <WH3027>? Or <WH6299>, Redeem me from the hand <WH3027> of the oppressors <WH6184>?
Teach <WH3384> me <WH2790>, and I will hold my peace; And cause me to understand <WH995> wherein I have erred <WH7686>.
How forcible <WH4834> are words <WH561> of uprightness <WH3476>! But your reproof <WH3198>, what doth it reprove <WH3198>?
Do ye think <WH2803> to reprove <WH3198> words <WH4405>, Seeing that the speeches <WH561> of one that is desperate <WH2976> are as wind <WH7307>?
Yea <WH5307>, ye would cast lots upon the fatherless <WH3490>, And make merchandise <WH3738> of your friend <WH7453>.
Now therefore be pleased <WH2974> to look <WH6437> upon me <WH6440>; For surely I shall not lie to your face <WH3576>.
Return <WH7725>, I pray you <WH5766>, let there be no injustice; Yea <WH7725>, return again, my cause is righteous <WH6664>.
Is there <WH3426> injustice <WH5766> on my tongue <WH3956>? Cannot my taste <WH2441> discern <WH995> mischievous things <WH1942>?
